key_discoveries: Hardware-native CX direction on ibm_fez is inverted from logical mapping.
Anchor Sequence (Harden control before linking) prevents phase kickback.
C=6 braid complexity is optimal (C=8 causes depth overhead).
Manifold absorbs mid-circuit faults (SVR=15.4) while detecting late faults.
95.1% parity witness accuracy demonstrates syndrome detection without decoder.
physics_notes: Phase kickback in v1.0 caused 90%+ inversion errors.
The braid creates a 'phase sink' that pulls state back to attractor.
SVR > 10 confirms Fault-Absorbing Manifold (not just gate cancellation).
Topology persists through 100+ identity cycles with <7% degradation.
Scale-out modularity allows 10x improvement over monolithic chains.
